metadata.title: CVE-2018-6508 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: Puppet Enterprise 2017.3.x prior to 2017.3.3 are vulnerable to a remoteexecution bug when a specially crafted string was passed into thefacter_task or puppet_conf tasks. This vulnerability only affects tasks inthe affected modules, if you are not using puppet tasks you are notaffected by this vulnerability.

criterions.comment: puppet-module-puppetlabs-apt: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
puppet-module-puppetlabs-apache: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
puppet-module-puppetlabs-mysql: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
